Ryan Persaud wrote:
>
> St. Ack,
>
> I am also trying to use HTML form credentials in Heretrix (1.8.0). I
> read the section that you provided a link for, but I seem to be
> missing some fields. From the manual: "In this section you can add
> login credentials that will allow Heritrix to gain access to areas of
> websites requiring authentication. As with all modules they are only
> added here (supplying a unique name for each credential) and then
> configured on the settings page (Section 6.3, "Settings")."
>
> I added a credential of type
> org.archive.crawler.datamodel.credential.HtmlFormCredential to
> SubModules and then went to the Settings page. Under
> credential-store, all that I see is the name of my credential and "?
> Credential that has all necessary for running a POST/GET to an HTML
> login form." How do I actually set the value of the credential? I
> apologize if I am missing something obvious.
>
















I'm not sure if the below comes across but its what you should see after 
adding a Credential in submodules tab.  Towards end of the order file, 
there will be a 'credential-store' with a credential of the name given 
when you added it back in submodules.  See how a 'credential-domain', 
'login-url', 'http-method', and 'form-items' textbox has been added (Do 
you get these?)?

Assuming you do, say you want to login to archive.org and its login page 
is http://www.archive.org/login.html.  You'd add 'archive.org' as domain 
and the just-cited URL as the 'login-url'.  Set whether the form we're 
to pass is POST or GET and then add per form item needed to gain access, 
a key and value where key is the form-item name such as 'password' -- it 
depends on whats in use on the login form -- and value is the actual 
password to submit.  You'll often also have to add a form-item for the 
submit button. 

Enable logging as suggested in user manual.  It helps trying to figure 
where the auth is failing.

Good luck,
St.Ack


*credential-store* 	? <javascript:doPop('Credentials used by heritrix 
authenticating. See http://crawler.archive.org/proposals/auth/ for 
background.')> 	Credentials used by heritrix authenticating.
*    credentials* 	? <javascript:doPop('Map of credentials.')> 	Map of 
credentials.
*      xxx* 	? <javascript:doPop('Credential that has all necessary for 
running a POST/GET to an HTML login form.')> 	Credential that has all 
necessary for running a POST/GET to an HTML login form.
        credential-domain:  	? <javascript:doPop('The root domain this 
credential goes against: E.g. www.archive.org')>  	
        login-uri:  	? <javascript:doPop('Full URI of page that contains 
the HTML login form we\'re to apply these credentials too: E.g. 
http://www.archive.org')>  	
        http-method:  	? <javascript:doPop('GET or POST')>  	
        form-items:  	? <javascript:doPop('Form items.')>  	
	 ->  		 

















>
> Thanks for the assistance,
> -Ryan
>
